hours_text:
## **Tickets to visit the Neill-Cochran House Museum can be purchased upon arrival at the front desk.**

Self-guided tours may be taken any time during Museum opening hours. Guided group tours are available upon request (reservation required). Be sure to join our email list, and follow us on Facebook and Instagram for updates.

**_Urban Enslavement in Austin - The NCHM Slave Quarters Tour_** is a guided tour of the building and grounds exploring the complicated influence of slavery on the city and how the impact of that institution resounds even today. This one-hour tour is offered on the third Saturday of every month starting at 1:30pm. Learn more and sign up [here](https://www.nchmuseum.org/slave-quarters-tour).

Museum Hours

**Open Wed - Sun 11AM - 4PM**

**2310 San Gabriel Street  
Austin, Texas 78705**

 _Purchase tickets at the link above or at the door._

Admission

General Admission includes a  
Self-Guided Audio Tour

General – $10  
Seniors – $8  
Students with ID – $8  
Members & children under 12 – Free  
Blue Star Family Members - Free

Tours

**Self-guided group tours** –  
$5 per person, $50 min. (10 person min.)

**Docent-guided group tours*** –  
$10 per person, $60 minimum

**Slave Quarters Guided Tour** –  
[Offered the 3rd Sunday of the month]  
General - $20, Seniors/Students - $15  
NCHM Members/NARM Members - $10  
Children 12 & under - Free

*Docent-guided tours must be scheduled in advance.  

Accessibility

collections_text:
## __**_Welcome to the Neill-Cochran House Museum_**

* * *

The **Neill-Cochran House Museum** is located in the heart of Austin, TX, just a few minutes walk from the UT Austin campus. We steward one of the city's oldest residences (1856), including Austin's only intact slave quarters. We share our site, Austin, and Texas history from the city's birth in 1839 up to 1930 through historically furnished spaces as well as numerous rotating art and history exhibitions. 

### [Learn More](/about-us)

### [Explore Our Collection](/collections)

### [Plan Your Visit](/visit)

## Touring the Historic Home

**Accessibility |** Our museum is wheelchair accessible for first floor exhibits, and interpretive materials are available for the second floor. 

**Hours |** Wednesday - Sunday, 11:00AM - 4:00PM

Self-guided tours may be taken any time the house is open. Be sure to join our email list, and follow us on Facebook and Instagram for updates.
